title: Excess Mortality in Western Europe during COVID-19
description: Using a three-year average pre-pandemic baseline.

title: Excess Mortality in Northern Europe during COVID-19
description: Using a three-year average pre-pandemic baseline.

title: Excess Mortality in Southern Europe during COVID-19
description: Using a three-year average pre-pandemic baseline.

title: Excess Mortality in Eastern Europe during COVID-19
description: Using a three-year average pre-pandemic baseline.

title: Excess Mortality in the EU during COVID-19
description: With a three-year average pre-pandemic baseline, Sweden saw the lowest excess mortality in the European Union.

title: Mortality in the USA & Sweden since 2000/'01
description: Age-standardized mortality by midyear seasons (July-June) shows no significant mortality increase in Sweden, in contrast to the USA.

title: Mortality in Germany since 2001
description: Yearly age-standardized mortality shows no significant increase in Germany during 2020, in contrast to the following two years of 2021/'22.

title: Excess Deaths in the USA during COVID-19
description: During the COVID-19 Pandemic, the USA recorded over a million more deaths than projected.

title: Florida vs California during COVID-19
description: Florida and California had very different public health approaches, but no significant difference in excess mortality.

title: Excess Mortality by Age Group in the USA during COVID-19
description: Contrary to the risk profile of COVID-19, the USA recorded the highest relative increase in excess mortality in the working age population.

title: Excess Mortality in Scandinavia during COVID-19
description: While Sweden saw most of its excess mortality during 2020, its two Scandinavian neighbors saw much larger excess mortality later on.

title: North vs South Dakota during COVID-19
description: Despite North Dakota's strict lockdowns and mask mandates, and South Dakota's lack thereof, both states saw similar COVID-19 outcomes.

title: Weekly Age-Standardized Mortality in the US during COVID-19
description: The initial winter & summer peaks of 2020 were followed by larger peaks in 2021 and winter of 2022. Mortality remains elevated throughout 2023.

title: Weekly Age-Standardized Mortality in Germany since 2015
description: Germany did not record much different excess mortality during the COVID-19 pandemic compared to previous years.

title: Excess Mortality Ranking in the EU during COVID-19
description: With a three-year average pre-pandemic baseline, only 11 of 23 countries recorded statistical significant excess mortality cumulatively during the pandemic years.

title: Excess Mortality Ranking in the US during COVID-19
description: The US recorded large amounts of excess mortality during the pandemic. Generally, a north to south & rich to poor trend can be observed.

title: Life Expectancy in Sweden and California
description: Life expectancy dropped by more than two years in California, while Sweden saw no significant decrease.
